intro: Sonchus ustulatus, commonly known as the scarlet sowthistle, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy stems and lobed leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its bright yellow flowers bloom from late spring to early autumn, and the plant is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in disturbed soils. It is considered a weed in agricultural settings but has also been used in traditional herbal medicine.
